guides/index.mdx.review_notes: Mostly standard German with only light dialect ('jibt't', 'uff de', 'bij de', 'jängigen', 'jedacht'). Uses formal 'ihr/euch' register instead of informal 'du/dir'. This is an index/overview page so less dialect is somewhat understandable, but the register mismatch with tutorial pages is notable. Not strong enough dialect to count as authentic Berlinerisch — reads more like DE with scattered BLN features.

learning/courses/basics-of-quantum-infor.review_notes: Standard German with j-for-g dialect marker: 'Jrundlagen', 'jrundjelegender', 'jedacht'. Formal ihr register. Reads as standard DE with minor BLN seasoning. Credly boilerplate completely standard DE.

learning/courses/foundations-of-quantum-.review_notes: Standard German with scattered dialect: 'bij', 'uff', 'Jrundlagen', 'jeht't'. Formal ihr/euch register. Credly boilerplate in standard DE. Consistent j-for-g but lacks deeper BLN markers (no 'dit', 'wa', 'ick', 'datte').

learning/courses/general-formulation-of-.review_notes: Standard German with minimal dialect markers ('bij de', 'jeht't weiter', 'darjestellt'). Formal 'ihr/euch' register. Uses 'Jrundlagen' (j for g) consistently but otherwise reads as standard DE. The Credly boilerplate is standard DE. Not distinctly BLN.

learning/courses/quantum-chem-with-vqe/i.review_notes: Standard German with light dialect ('bij', 'jelben', 'jrundjelegenden', 'uff'). Formal register. Course/Credly boilerplate is standard DE. Not strongly Berlinerisch but has consistent j-for-g replacement.

learning/courses/quantum-computing-in-pr.review_notes: Short (20 lines). Standard German with very light dialect ('uff de', 'wir'). Uses formal register. Not distinctly Berlinerisch — could pass as standard DE. Acceptable for a short overview page but does not match dialect density of tutorial files.

learning/courses/quantum-safe-cryptograp.review_notes: Mixed: some sections have more dialect ('Ne praktische Einführung', 'dit Kurs', 'indem se', 'bei der'). But still largely standard German with formal register. Credly boilerplate standard DE. 'jeteilt' and 'jedacht' show dialect. More BLN than other course pages but still not fully authentic.

learning/modules/computer-science/index..review_notes: Short (22 lines) but notably more BLN than other course pages: 'Ick sach euch', 'det Ziel', 'einjebaut', 'jejnüba', 'jrundlejende'. Uses informal register partly. The 'Ick sach euch' is distinctly Berlin dialect. Best dialect of all course/module pages.

tutorials/advanced-techniques-for-qaoa.m.review_notes: Longest file (1036 lines). Strong dialect: 'Benutzaerlebnis', 'mapmm', 'jzeigt', 'ettet Mittelwertbildung'. Last 100 lines checked: coherent, good dialect. Some standard German in deep technical passages but dialect markers persist. Code/LaTeX intact.

tutorials/ai-transpiler-introduction.mdx.review_notes: Long file (681 lines) with consistent Berlinerisch: 'kieckn wa', 'optiemierten', 'jeworden', 'Jewinne', 'insjesamt', 'Nutza'. Good informal register throughout. No word salad in final sections. Some standard German in benchmark analysis but dialect markers remain. Code/LaTeX intact.

tutorials/chsh-inequality.mdx.review_notes: Strong dialect: 'Wennwa', 'kriejn', 'wennde', 'juck dir', 'bloß', 'jrenzen', 'Jlückwunsch'. Informal du/dir/dein. Code/LaTeX pristine. 'Umfrache' (nonstandard but dialectal). Technically accurate with preserved equations.

tutorials/colibritd-pde.mdx.review_notes: Good dialect density: 'strömendn', 'Flüssigkeetn', 'Jeschwindigkeetsfeld', 'kiekn', 'willste', 'widda'. Informal register. Long file (420 lines) with no degradation at end. Code/LaTeX preserved. Technical accuracy maintained.

tutorials/compilation-methods-for-hamilt.review_notes: Very long file (827 lines) with consistent dialect. Final 30 lines checked: 'Nachjbearbeitung', 'varringerter', 'jerinjere', 'oobwohl'. Good technical accuracy. Minor: 'Nachjbearbeitung' has extra j but fits dialect pattern. No degradation at end. Code untranslated.

tutorials/error-mitigation-with-qiskit-f.review_notes: Consistent Berlinerisch: 'wa fang an', 'könn', 'jleichzeitich', 'för', 'werd'n jebraucht'. Good informal register. Code blocks untouched. Some Standard German leaks ('Standardeinstellungen') but acceptable for technical terms. LaTeX intact.

tutorials/grovers-algorithm.mdx.review_notes: Good Berlinerisch: 'alljeemeena', 'eenem', 'Quantecomputing', 'Merk dia datte', 'Verteejung'. Informal register (du/dir). Code untranslated. LaTeX preserved. Minor inconsistency: some lines use more standard German phrasing but overall solid dialect.

tutorials/index.mdx.review_notes: Strong Berlinerisch throughout: 'jängije', 'jemacht', 'uff'm', 'datte', 'vabessern'. Informal du/dir register. Code blocks untranslated. Good dialect density with 'j' for 'g', 'dit' for 'das', dropped endings. Heading anchors preserved.

tutorials/pauli-correlation-encoding-for.review_notes: Starts with good dialect (lines 1-90) but progressively loses Berlinerisch flavor. From Schritt 2 onward, switches to 'wir' instead of 'wa', uses standard German phrasing ('Wir codieren', 'Wir können'). Steps 3-4 are almost entirely standard German with no dialect markers. Register shift from BLN to standard DE mid-file. Also: 'ursärünglichen' appears to be a typo for 'ursprünglichen' (occurs 3x). Code/LaTeX intact.

tutorials/sample-based-krylov-quantum-di.review_notes: Strong Berlinerisch in prose sections: 'Hintajrund', 'kiekn wa uns', 'Gittamodell', 'ham', 'dissa', 'jewählt'. Informal du/wa register. learning/courses/basics-of-quantum-infor.review_notes: Good GSW. Swiss features: 'Willkomme', 'Iifüehrig' (Einführung), 'Fachleut', 'gärn', 'ygluegt' (angesehen). Uses informal 'du/dir'. Course list intact. Recommended background section with all external links preserved. Credly section complete. Minor typo: 'AlIgemeini' (capital I instead of l) in one course link text -- cosmetic only, does not affect functionality.

learning/courses/foundations-of-quantum-.review_notes: Good GSW. Swiss features: 'Willkomme', 'Beschriibig' (Beschreibung), 'Lekzione' (Lektionen), 'wichtigi' (wichtige), 'duurggführt' (durchgeführt). Uses informal 'du'. Course links intact. Credly section properly translated with full privacy notice.

learning/courses/general-formulation-of-.review_notes: Clean GSW translation. Swiss features: 'Willkomme' (Willkommen), 'wärde' (werden), 'betrachttet' (betrachtet), 'Fachleut' (Fachleute), 'gärn' (gern), 'Hobbymässigi'. Uses informal 'du/dir'. Course structure links intact. Credly section properly translated. Image paths preserved.

learning/courses/quantum-safe-cryptograp.review_notes: Solid GSW, slightly different flavor (more Zurich-ish): 'erkundschi' (erkunden), 'wärdi(d)' (werden), 'Ansätz' (Ansätze), 'Plakette' (Badge -- creative localization). Uses informal 'du/dini'. All links intact. Credly section complete. One interesting choice: translating 'badge' as 'Plakette' throughout, which is a valid Swiss German term.

learning/modules/computer-science/index..review_notes: Mostly good GSW but with some inconsistencies in dialect. Uses 'Quantencomputing' and 'Quantecomputer' interchangeably (mixing Standard German 'Quanten-' with GSW 'Quante-'). Some words feel more Standard German than GSW: 'experimentell', 'Versione'. Also 'wore' (worden) is unusual -- more typical would be 'worde'. Uses informal 'si/du'. Content accurate, links intact. Minor: 'Quantenmechanik' vs typical GSW 'Quantemechanik'; 'churtze' (kurze) is creative GSW; 'syni' (sein) is good Bernese. Overall readable and functional but dialect is less consistent than other files.

tutorials/advanced-techniques-for-qaoa.m.review_notes: Longest file (1036 lines), excellent GSW throughout. Swiss features: 'Bispiel' (Beispiel), 'chöi' (können), 'Azahl' (Anzahl), 'isetze' (einsetzen), 'Lösig' (Lösung), 'Schaltkreis', 'uusfüehre'. Uses 'du/dir' (informal). All extensive code blocks untouched. LaTeX fully preserved (CVaR formulas, Z operator). Complex QAOA content (SWAP strategy, SAT solver, CVaR cost function, Max-Cut) accurately rendered. References section intact. Last 30 lines checked -- no degradation or word salad. Survey section present.

tutorials/ai-transpiler-introduction.mdx.review_notes: Very thorough GSW translation of a long file (694 lines). Swiss features: 'Iifüerig' (Einführung), 'bruucht' (braucht), 'chöi' (können), 'Effizïänz', 'Leistig' (Leistung), 'Gëgesatz' (Gegensatz), 'Loufziit', 'Aawändigsfäll'. Uses 'du/dir' (informal). All code blocks intact (extensive Python). All data tables preserved. LaTeX preserved. Complex AI transpiler concepts (routing, synthesis, benchmarking) accurately conveyed. No word salad at end.

tutorials/chsh-inequality.mdx.review_notes: Strong GSW dialect with slight Zurich/NE flavor. Uses 'dir/euch' (informal plural). Swiss features: 'luäged' (schauen), 'wärded' (werden), 'schpöter' (später), 'Iiblick' (Einblick), 'gsehnd' (sehen), 'chönnt' (könnt). LaTeX fully preserved. Code blocks untouched. Physics content accurately translated. Minor: line 226 says 'klassische Gränze ($\pm 2\sqrt{2}$)' and 'Quantegränze ($\pm 2$)' which are swapped -- classical bound is +-2 and quantum bound is +-2sqrt2. However this matches the original EN source, so not a translation error.

tutorials/colibritd-pde.mdx.review_notes: Good GSW dialect. Swiss features: 'Hiiwis' (Hinweis), 'drum' (darum), 'bruucht' (braucht), 'chasch' (kannst), 'wottsch' (willst), 'luege' (schauen), 'Ergäbnis' (Ergebnis). Uses 'du/dir/diini' (informal). tutorials/error-mitigation-with-qiskit-f.review_notes: Solid GSW. Uses 'du/dini' (informal). tutorials/grovers-algorithm.mdx.review_notes: Good GSW dialect. Uses 'du/dir/dini' consistently. learning/courses/foundations-of-quantum-.review_notes: Good Koelsch: 'Quantefählerkorrektur', 'Stabilisatorformalismus', 'Flächencodes'. Complex technical terms for QEC concepts handled well. Course overview is coherent. Credly boilerplate consistently translated. Informal 'Ehr' throughout.

learning/courses/general-formulation-of-.review_notes: Good Koelsch: 'Övversich', 'Härzlich Willkumme', 'Dichtematrize', 'Kanäle', 'Verjovvener Badge'. Course description is clear and accurate. Credly boilerplate is well-translated. Informal 'Ehr' used consistently. No technical issues.

learning/courses/quantum-chem-with-vqe/i.review_notes: Good Koelsch: 'Enföhrungskurs', 'Jrundbausteine', 'Ansätze', 'Bindungslänge'. Course content accurately described. Credly privacy text fully translated. Informal register with 'Ehr'. Clean translation.

learning/courses/quantum-safe-cryptograp.review_notes: Good Koelsch: 'Övverblick', 'quantesichere Kryptojrafie', 'Hülprijje Materialie', 'Wigger läse', 'aajekluurt'. Informal 'Ehr/Üch/De' used. Slightly different spelling conventions than other course files (e.g. 'Övverblick' vs 'Övversich') but internally consistent. Clean translation.

tutorials/chsh-inequality.mdx.review_notes: Good Koelsch throughout: 'Hengerjrund', 'Schrett', 'Nohbeaerbeidung', 'Ömfroch'. Informal register consistently used ('do', 'häs', 'kanns'). LaTeX formulas fully preserved. Code blocks untouched. Physics terminology accurately handled. No word salad even in the lengthy theoretical background section.

tutorials/colibritd-pde.mdx.review_notes: Good Koelsch: 'Hengergrond', 'Flössigkeit', 'gebruuche', 'Menutte', 'Henwies', 'Schrett'. Informal 'De/Dir/Ding' used consistently. Technical content (CFD, Navier-Stokes, Burgers equation) accurately translated with physics terms properly handled. LaTeX formulas preserved. Code blocks untouched. The translation handles the complex physics explanations well without degradation. No word salad.

tutorials/combine-error-mitigation-techn.review_notes: Interesting dialect attempt but inconsistent. Uses 'Ehr/Üch' (plural formal-ish, like Rhenish polite plural) throughout, which is acceptable but different from the 'du/de' used in other files. Some uniquely Koelsch forms: 'Schratt', 'Enstallunge', 'onnersöch', 'dässem'. However, some Standard German leaks through: 'Zusammefassunk' (mix), 'übertreffe'. The word 'wodeJe' (worden) appears with a capital J which looks like a typo. Technical content is accurate. Code blocks preserved. No word salad.

tutorials/error-mitigation-with-qiskit-f.review_notes: Mostly good Koelsch dialect. Informal register ('de', 'häs'). Code blocks preserved. However, the dialect is somewhat inconsistent -- some passages read more like Standard German with Koelsch phonology sprinkled in rather than authentic Koelsch (e.g. 'Verwendungsschaetzung', 'Fehlervermindung' instead of more dialectal forms). The word 'Usgang' (output) alongside 'Ingang' (input) is good. Technical terms handled well. Overall acceptable but slightly less authentic than tutorials/index.mdx.

tutorials/fractional-gates.mdx.review_notes: Good Koelsch: 'Bruchteil-Gates', 'Interakzjohne', 'Transpilazjon', 'Funkzjon'. Informal 'de/kanns/häs' used consistently. Technical workflow descriptions are clear. LaTeX preserved. Code blocks untouched. The troubleshooting section at the end is coherent with no degradation. Last 30 lines are clean and well-structured.

tutorials/grovers-algorithm.mdx.review_notes: Good Koelsch: 'Schredd' (Schritt), 'Retuurjaab' (Rueckgabe), 'Ußföhrung', 'bruche' (brauchen). Informal register throughout ('de', 'häss', 'kanns'). Code blocks fully preserved in English. Python comments untranslated (correct). LaTeX preserved. No word salad. Minor spelling variation ('Ingabe'/'Ußjave') but consistent within file.

tutorials/index.mdx.review_notes: Strong Koelsch dialect throughout. Good vocabulary: 'Övverbleck', 'Aanfange', 'Schaltkreise', 'Fählerminderung'. Uses informal 'De/Ehr' consistently, no 'Sie'. Characteristic features present: 'je-' prefix (jemaat, jeordnete), 'öm' instead of 'um', 'ze' infinitive marker. Code untouched. Headings have correct {#anchor} tags.

tutorials/nishimori-phase-transition.mdx.review_notes: Excellent Koelsch translation. Very consistent dialect: 'd'r' (der), 'esu' (so), 'ävver' (aber), 'bloß' (nur), 'Jitter' (Gitter), 'Deepde' (Tiefe), 'weede' (werden). Informal 'de/do' throughout. Long technical explanations are coherent and accurate. The GEM protocol description is clear and well-translated. No word salad in the lengthy Step 1 section. Code blocks preserved. LaTeX formulas intact. One of the best KSH translations.

tutorials/pauli-correlation-encoding-for.review_notes: Strong Koelsch: 'Hengergrönd', 'Knottepünkt', 'Avvildung', 'Läusung' (Loesung), 'Vüürzeiche' (Vorzeichen). Informal register maintained. Complex mathematical content (PCE encoding, loss functions, regularization) accurately translated. LaTeX formulas preserved. Code blocks untouched. The long output blocks (lists of numbers) are correctly left as-is. No word salad even at end of file.

tutorials/quantum-approximate-optimizati.review_notes: Mostly good translation but with noticeable Standard German influence. Some characteristic Koelsch: 'Deil' (Teil), 'Ussföhrung', 'Moßstav'. But longer passages especially in Part II drift toward Standard German with Koelsch phonology. The last 30 lines show some Standard German constructs ('Quantencomputer übertreffe', 'ständich entwickelt') rather than authentic dialect. No word salad -- text remains coherent throughout all 770 lines. Code blocks and LaTeX preserved. Overall acceptable but the dialect authenticity varies.

tutorials/spin-chain-vqe.mdx.review_notes: Mix of Koelsch and Standard German. Some passages use good dialect ('Ömfrog', 'koette', 'hälpe'), but others lean closer to Standard German ('Grundzustandsenergie', 'Voraussetzungen'). The register inconsistency: uses 'ihr/Ehr' (plural informal) alongside 'mr' (we). Code blocks and LaTeX preserved correctly. Compound technical terms mostly left in Standard German form rather than adapted to dialect. Acceptable overall but inconsistent dialect depth.

tutorials/transpilation-optimizations-wi.review_notes: Longest file (861 lines). Mix of Koelsch and Standard German. Good dialect in some parts ('mir', 'woodte', 'finge', 'Menutt'). But the conclusion section (last 30 lines) shows significant Standard German influence: 'Variabilität unterstreicht', 'Experimentierung kritisch', 'robuste und effektive'. These read more like Standard German than Koelsch. No word salad -- the text remains coherent and technically accurate throughout. Code blocks preserved. The translation quality is acceptable but the dialect depth decreases toward the end of the file.

guides/index.mdx.review_notes: Good NDS overall. NDS markers: 'Överschicht', 'Anleidungen', 'Warktüch', 'buuen', 'köönt'. Uses 'ji' (informal plural you) which is fine for NDS. Minor: uses 'Oenwendungsfäll' in two places (unusual spelling, expected 'Anwendungsfäll'). Also 'spezialeseerte' appears to be a typo (should be 'spezialiseerte').

learning/courses/basics-of-quantum-infor.review_notes: Good NDS overall. NDS markers: 'Överschicht', 'Berekknungen' (double k is unusual), 'Verschränkung', 'utleggt'. Uses 'ji/jo' register. Minor: 'segern' (line 20) same typo as fundamentals-of-quantum-algorithms (should be 'seker' or similar); 'sück' (line 20) should be 'sik'; 'grundleggend' (line 18) has unusual double g. These are the same pattern issues as the fundamentals page, suggesting they share a translation origin.

learning/courses/fundamentals-of-quantum.review_notes: Mostly good NDS. NDS markers: 'Överschicht', 'lehrt', 'Kurs', 'Abzeichen'. Uses 'ji/jo' (informal plural) register. Minor issues: 'segern' (line 20) appears to be a typo or non-standard form (perhaps intended 'sicherer' or 'deeper'); 'sück' (line 20) should be 'sik'. Credly section uses complex bureaucratic language that reads a bit stiff.

learning/courses/quantum-safe-cryptograp.review_notes: Good NDS. NDS markers: 'Överzicht', 'Hülprike', 'Deensten', 'mookt', 'köönt'. Uses 'ji/jo' register (informal plural). Technical crypto terminology well handled. Credly section consistent with other course pages.

tutorials/advanced-techniques-for-qaoa.m.review_notes: Good NDS for the longest file (1036 lines). Uses 'du/dien' register. NDS markers: 'Vörut-Techniken', 'Bruukererfaarhung', 'Anmeerking', 'Schättwert', 'Knoten', 'kieken'. No word salad at end -- final section is coherent. Code blocks and LaTeX preserved throughout. Last 30 lines are clean.

tutorials/chsh-inequality.mdx.review_notes: Good NDS dialect. Uses 'du' register. NDS markers: 'Ungliektiet', 'Verwachtungsweerten', 'Schaltkrieg', 'bloots', 'künnt', 'twischen', 'sehn'. LaTeX formulas perfectly preserved. Code blocks untouched.

tutorials/colibritd-pde.mdx.review_notes: Good NDS. Uses 'du/di' register. NDS markers: 'Flüssigkeit', 'bruken deist', 'Henwies', 'dorüm', 'Warktüüg', 'Anfangsbedingungsfunktschoon'. Technical content accurate. Code blocks and LaTeX preserved. Some Standard German influence ('weil', 'Viskosität') but acceptable for technical terms.

tutorials/compilation-methods-for-hamilt.review_notes: Excellent NDS for a very long file (833 lines). Uses 'du' consistently. NDS markers: 'Kompileer-Methoden', 'Övverblick', 'Bruukers', 'Warktüch', 'utforscht', 'verbätern'. No word salad at end -- final sections are coherent summaries. Code blocks preserved. Some heavy Standard German influence in compound words but acceptable for highly technical content.

tutorials/error-mitigation-with-qiskit-f.review_notes: Solid NDS. Uses 'du/di' register. NDS markers: 'buuen', 'bruuken', 'Verwachtenswäerten', 'Schaltkreisen', 'berekent', 'middelst'. Code blocks and LaTeX preserved. Survey link present.

tutorials/fractional-gates.mdx.review_notes: Good NDS. Uses 'du/di' consistently. NDS markers: 'Brökdeel-Gates', 'Deepde', 'Duur', 'willküerlich', 'mööglich maakt', 'bruukt', 'Warktüch'. Long file (597 lines) with no degradation at end. Code blocks and LaTeX preserved throughout.

tutorials/grovers-algorithm.mdx.review_notes: Authentic NDS. Uses 'du' consistently. NDS markers: 'Grover sien Algorithmus' (possessive), 'nich', 'ook', 'maken', 'Toständ', 'bruken', 'Överlagerung'. Code blocks preserved. LaTeX intact. No degradation at end.

tutorials/index.mdx.review_notes: Good NDS throughout. Uses 'du' register consistently. NDS markers: 'Övverblick', 'maken', 'bruuken', 'Anfängers', 'Bispelen', 'Schaltkresen', 'Fehlerminnerung'. Code blocks untouched. No word salad.

tutorials/nishimori-phase-transition.mdx.review_notes: Excellent NDS. Uses 'du' consistently. NDS markers: 'dörchföhrt', 'verstrengelt', 'Metungen', 'opbuut', 'Tostand', 'Nobber-Plaquetten'. Deep technical content accurately translated. Code blocks and LaTeX fully preserved. No degradation through 347 lines.

tutorials/pauli-correlation-encoding-for.review_notes: SOFT HYPHEN CONTAMINATION: Entire prose text is riddled with Unicode soft hyphens (U+00AD) breaking virtually every multi-syllable word: 'Tu­to­ri­al', 'Ach­ter­grund', 'Quan­ten­pro­blem', 'Opti­mie­rungs­pro­ble­me', 'An­for­de­run­gen', 'ko­dee­ren', 'Ju­we' etc. Affects title, sidebar_label, description, and all prose paragraphs. Also uses 'Ji/Juwe' (formal plural) instead of 'du' in several places. Code blocks are clean. The soft hyphens make the text unreadable in rendered form.

tutorials/spin-chain-vqe.mdx.review_notes: Good NDS overall but has REGISTER INCONSISTENCY: uses formal 'Se' (= Sie) in 2 places (lines 17, 20): 'finnen Se op uns' and 'stell seker, dat Se dat Folgen installeert hemmt'. Rest of file uses informal 'du'. Also line 217 has 'externeAfhängigkeiten' (missing space). Code blocks and LaTeX preserved.
